# Summary
Example runbook steps built using liquid templating. Kickstart runbook build out and inspire greater customizaiton.

_Note:
These examples are designed to be copy pasted into runbook steps. They contain comments to help steer users towards an intented use case. Feel free to delete any text in {% comment %}{% endcomment %} blocks._

# Useful Resources
## Docs
* [Firehydrant template variable documentation | https://support.firehydrant.com/hc/en-us/articles/4409136426004-Using-template-variables-in-Runbooks]
* [FireHydrant API documentation | https://api.firehydrant.io/v1/incidents]
* [Introductory Liquid Documentation | https://shopify.github.io/liquid/basics/introduction]
* [Deeper Dive Liquid Documentation | https://shopify.dev/api/liquid]
* [Slack mrkdwn documentation | https://api.slack.com/reference/surfaces/formatting]

## Tools
* [Liquid Playground with preloaded incident and retrospective data model | https://liquidjs.com/playground.html#,]
* [Tool for testing datetime formats in liquid | http://www.strfti.me/]
